intro: Dasistoma drummondii var. serrata, commonly known as the serrate dasistoma, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Texas and New Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to green flowers that bloom in late spring. It is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
